user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_post_process:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_post_process (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                  const char *post_data,
                  size_t post_data_len)
{
  if (0 == post_data_len)
    return MHD_YES;
  if (NULL == pp)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED)))
    return post_process_urlencoded (pp,
                                    post_data,
                                    post_data_len);
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA)))
    return post_process_multipart (pp,
                                   post_data,
                                   post_data_len);
  /* this should never be reached */
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED)))
    return post_process_urlencoded (pp,
                                    post_data,
                                    post_data_len);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The fragment calls post_process_urlencoded(pp, post_data, post_data_len). This by itself is not a self-call and does not violate Rule 17.2. A violation would occur only if post_process_urlencoded (or some function it calls) calls MHD_post_process either directly or via a call chain (i.e., post_process_urlencoded -> ... -> MHD_post_process), creating indirect recursion.
